ETYMOLOGY: From Old French riban or ruban, possibly of Germanic origin.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A long, narrow strip of fabric, such as silk or velvet, used for decoration, tying, or fastening.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一条细长的织物带，如丝绸或天鹅绒，用于装饰、捆绑或系紧。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She tied her hair back with a blue ribbon.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她用一条蓝色丝带把头发扎了起来。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A strip of material with a specific function, such as an inked ribbon in a printer or a decorative strip awarded as a prize.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 具有特定功能的带状材料，例如打印机中的墨带或作为奖品颁发的装饰性条带。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He proudly wore the first-place ribbon on his chest.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他自豪地把第一名的绶带佩戴在胸前。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A long, narrow piece or strip of something, especially when appearing as a winding line.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 细长的一段或一条，尤其指蜿蜒的线条状物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: A ribbon of road wound through the mountains.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 一条蜿蜒的公路穿过群山。
